ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.2_0: At that time Venerable Channa was misbehaving.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.3_0: When other monks asked him why,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.7_0: “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s expert on the Monastic Law.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.8_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.9_0: “How can Venerable Channa say this when legitimately corrected by the monks?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.10_0: ‘I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s expert on the Monastic Law.’” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.11_0: “Is it true, Channa, that you said this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.12_0: ‘I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s Monastic Law.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.15_0: “... Foolish man, how can you say this when legitimately corrected by the monks?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.16_0: ‘I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s expert on the Monastic Law.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.17_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.18_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.19.1_0: ‘If a monk, when legitimately corrected by the monks, says, “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who is an expert on the Monastic Law,” he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.20_0: A monk who is training should understand, should question, should enquire.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.1.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.1.8_0: whatever training rule has been laid down by the Buddha—this is called “legitimately”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.1.9_0: When corrected in regard to this, he says, “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expert on the Monastic Law.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.1.9_1: If I’m wise, I’ll question one who is competent, and intelligent, and learned,” “I’m an expounder of the Teaching,” he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.1_0: If the one who corrects him is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.2_0: If the one who corrects him is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.3_0: If the one who corrects him is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.4_0: If he is being corrected about something that has not been laid down—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.5_0: if he says, “I won’t talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart, but doesn’t lead to harm monk,” “I’ll recite the Monastic Law,” “I’ll question one who’s wise,” “I’ll question one who’s competent,” “I’ll question one who’s intelligent,” “I’ll question one who’s learned,” “I’ll question an expounder of the Teaching,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.6_0: If he is being corrected by one who is not fully ordained, whether or not it has been laid down—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.7_0: if he says, “I won’t talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart, but doesn’t lead to harm monk,” “I’ll recite the Monastic Law,” “I’ll question one who’s wise,” “I’ll question one who’s competent,” “I’ll question one who’s intelligent,” “I’ll question one who’s learned,” “I’ll question an expounder of the Teaching,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.8_0: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he perceives him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.9_0: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.10_0: If it is to one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
